nodes.name: Human extinction from engineered pandemic
nodes.description: A future biological outbreak with very high transmissibility and 100 % fatality that could eliminate humanity.
nodes.node_rationale: Top-level existential risk repeatedly cited under ‘Biosecurity/Pandemic Response’.

nodes.name: Human disempowerment from misaligned advanced AI
nodes.description: Scenario in which advanced, misaligned artificial intelligence systems gain decisive strategic advantage and permanently disempower humankind.
nodes.node_rationale: Listed under ‘AI’ section as pivotal threat motivating forecasting.

nodes.name: Delayed crisis response due to lack of early warning forecasting in existential risks
nodes.description: Failure to detect and act on rapidly developing catastrophic scenarios because decision-makers lack timely, accurate probability estimates.
nodes.node_rationale: Core problem identified in ‘Why does this matter?’ and throughout.

nodes.name: Short-range forecasting improvements reduce existential risks without long-range forecasting accuracy
nodes.description: Argument that better predictions on a 1 week–3 year horizon can robustly lower x-risk even if 10 + year forecasts remain hard.
nodes.node_rationale: Stated under ‘Why focus on short-range forecasting rather than long-range forecasting?’

nodes.name: Private forecasting structures preserve security and efficiency for high-stakes questions
nodes.description: Keeping forecasts internal avoids info hazards, maintains epistemic edge, and reduces wasted effort compared with public markets.
nodes.node_rationale: Discussed in ‘Why private forecasting?’

nodes.name: Establish Early Warning Forecasting Center to convert diverse data into accurate short-range forecasts
nodes.description: Design vision for a large entity that continuously produces calibrated, decision-relevant forecasts for EA crises.
nodes.node_rationale: Main proposal introduced in ‘Early Warning Forecasting Center’ section.

nodes.name: Organizing forecasters within firm-like structure instead of markets
nodes.description: Choosing a hierarchical firm model over prediction markets to minimise redundancy and coordinate <1000 staff.
nodes.node_rationale: Justified in ‘Why private forecasting?’ reasons 1–2.

nodes.name: Centralized forecasting teams partitioned into cold, signal, and hot units
nodes.description: Cold teams periodically revise baselines; signal teams monitor data streams; hot teams turn new signals into rapid probability updates.
nodes.node_rationale: Detailed under ‘How should a forecasting center be structured?’

nodes.name: Private data pipelines and OSINT integration for signal detection
nodes.description: Building bespoke data sources, open-source intelligence scraping and engineered pipelines to improve signal quality for forecasts.
nodes.node_rationale: Mentioned as role of data engineers & potential Variant 1.

nodes.name: Threshold-based alert protocol to EA decision-makers
nodes.description: Pre-defined probability thresholds automatically trigger confidential briefings to trusted actors like Open Philanthropy.
nodes.node_rationale: Described in pandemic example under ‘Biosecurity/Pandemic Response’.

nodes.name: Co-location with crisis response unit for rapid action on forecasts
nodes.description: Pairing the forecasting centre with a specialised team that immediately executes mitigations once alerts are raised.
nodes.node_rationale: Variant 2 in ‘Variants’ section.

nodes.name: Embedding forecasting capability within national government agency
nodes.description: Locating the forecasting organisation inside a body such as the US government to guide national crisis policy.
nodes.node_rationale: Variant 3 in ‘Variants’ section.

nodes.name: Historical epidemic and nuclear risk forecasting projects showing predictive value
nodes.description: Previous specialised forecasting efforts (e.g., Epidemic Forecasting.org, Samotsvety nuclear forecasts) that provided actionable estimates.
nodes.node_rationale: Cited as earlier examples in multiple sections.

nodes.name: Empirical studies showing small prediction markets underperform expert forecasters
nodes.description: Forum-linked study comparing top forecasters and domain experts indicating limited value of small internal markets.
nodes.node_rationale: Referenced in ‘Why private forecasting?’ point 1.5.

nodes.name: Observed EA community delays in acting on early COVID-19 warnings
nodes.description: After recognising COVID-19 early, the EA community still failed to execute aggressive mitigations (e.g. evacuations, stock shorting).
nodes.node_rationale: Critique in Variant 2 motivating crisis-response pairing.

nodes.name: UK government adoption of superforecasting methods demonstrates governmental integration feasibility
nodes.description: Economist article cited showing UK intelligence services using superforecasters, evidencing possible state uptake.
nodes.node_rationale: Quoted under Variant 3 discussion.

nodes.name: Establish EA Early Warning Forecasting Center as private organization
nodes.description: Set up and fund a standalone, privately-run forecasting firm with 50-1000 staff focused on existential-risk early warnings.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Organisation-building sits outside model-development phases – described in ‘Early Warning Forecasting Center’ design.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Purely conceptual proposal with no pilot yet – entire post is preliminary vision.
nodes.node_rationale: Primary actionable recommendation.

nodes.name: Integrate civilian OSINT arm into forecasting center operations
nodes.description: Recruit analysts to conduct systematic open-source intelligence gathering that feeds custom data streams into forecasts.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Adds organisational capability after centre creation – ‘Variant 1’.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Suggested variant only – no implementation yet.
nodes.node_rationale: Actionable extension explicitly proposed.

nodes.name: Pair forecasting center with dedicated crisis response unit for rapid deployment
nodes.description: Create or contract a rapid-response group that automatically executes contingency plans when forecast thresholds are breached.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Idea stage only; no pilots reported.
nodes.node_rationale: Targets shortfall identified from COVID-19 experience.

nodes.name: Negotiate incorporation of forecasting center within US government to inform policy
nodes.description: Engage policymakers to host the forecasting operation inside a federal agency, ensuring direct influence on national decisions.
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Speculative recommendation with no concrete progress.
nodes.node_rationale: Explicit pathway discussed to leverage state power.
